availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Francis Peak (Trimble County, Kentucky farmer and clerk)

body.p: Trimble County, Kentucky farmer and clerk. Kentucky native. Married to Margaret A. Peak. Father of George Peak, Charlotte Peak, Robert F. Peak, Hallie Peak, and Lizzie S. Peak. Farmer in Trimble County in 1863. Clerk of the Trimble Circuit Court from 1863 to 1866. Clerk of the Trimble County Court from 1864 to 1866.

bibl.p: Find A Grave, "William Francis Peak (1829-1911)," Memorial #22471041, http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=22471041&ref=acom (accessed March 31, 2017); "Veteran Banker William F Peak is Dead," The Courier-Journal (Louisville, Ky.), January 30, 1911, p. 5; Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trimble County, Bedford, p. 5; Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), Trimble County, KY, June/July 1863, p. 190, (Accessed via ancestry.com); “Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1863,” in 1864 Kentucky Documents, Legislative Document No. 10. (Frankfort, Ky.: Wm. E. Hughes, State Printer, 1864), 301-306; “Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1864,” in 1865 Kentucky Documents, Legislative Document No. 1. (Frankfort, Ky.: George D. Prentice, State Printer, 1865), 9-12; “Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1865,” in 1865/66 Kentucky Documents, Legislative Document No. 1. (Frankfort, Ky.: George D. Prentice, State Printer, 1866), 9-12; “Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1866,” in 1866 Kentucky Documents, Legislative Document No. 1. (Frankfort, Ky.: John H. Harney, Public Printer, 1866), 347-350.
